poem:
Title: "The Weight of Borders"

Against the dawn,
the story unfolds in crumpled newsprint - 
Small groups, like errant thoughts,
trickling through the vein of wounded Ukraine.
Silhouettes shudder in the anonymous artillery,
Just names in typeface,
destinies sketched by blunt pencils,
A dance of dread and resilience;
In the scribbled lines of conflict,
poetry emerges in the face of the devouring, ruthless eastern march.
